oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Implementation of bioherbicides and seed treatment in organic farming
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kuehne, Stefan
Verschwele, Arnd
von Hoersten, Dieter
Jahn, Marga
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
Breeding, genetics and propagation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The paper gives an overview over the prospects and risks of the application of bioherbicides in Organic Farming and wants to support the general acceptance by the EEC Council Regulation on Organic Production of Agricultural Products. Another problem of current importance is the maintenance of seed health. Several methods of seed treatments and their practical use are described (hot water, hot air, microwave steam, radio-frequency, low energy electrons, micro-organisms and natural substances).
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Kuehne, Stefan; Verschwele, Arnd; von Hoersten, Dieter and Jahn, Marga (2005) Implementation of bioherbicides and seed treatment in organic farming. Paper at: Researching Sustainable Systems - International Scientific Conference on Organic Agriculture, Adelaide, Australia, September 21-23, 2005. [Unpublished]
